questions.question: What does a red traffic signal light mean?
questions.explanation: A red signal means stop. You can make a right turn after you stop and yield to pedestrians and other traffic.

questions.question: What does a yellow diamond-shaped sign indicate?
questions.explanation: Yellow diamond-shaped signs are used to warn drivers of potential hazards or changing road conditions.

questions.question: What does a green arrow signal mean?
options: The light is about to turn red
You have the right-of-way to turn in the direction the arrow is pointing
questions.correctAnswer: You have the right-of-way to turn in the direction the arrow is pointing
questions.explanation: A green arrow signal means you have the right-of-way to turn in the direction the arrow is pointing.

questions.question: Who has the right-of-way at an intersection with no crosswalks?
questions.explanation: Pedestrians always have the right-of-way at intersections, regardless of whether a crosswalk is marked.

questions.question: When are you allowed to exceed the posted speed limit?
questions.explanation: It is against the law to exceed the posted speed limit under any circumstances.

questions.question: Where should you not park your vehicle?
questions.explanation: Parking in a crosswalk is prohibited as it can obstruct pedestrian traffic and create safety hazards.

questions.question: What should you do when driving in foggy conditions?
questions.explanation: In foggy conditions, use your low-beam headlights to increase visibility.

questions.question: What does a flashing yellow traffic signal light mean?
options: The light is about to turn red
questions.explanation: A flashing yellow signal means slow down and proceed with caution.

questions.question: What does a No U-Turn sign mean?
options: U-turns are allowed only during certain hours
questions.explanation: A No U-Turn sign indicates that U-turns are prohibited.

questions.question: Who has the right-of-way when two vehicles arrive at an intersection at the same time?
options: The vehicle that is moving faster
questions.explanation: At an intersection where there is no stop sign, yield sign, or oncoming traffic signal, vehicles must yield to vehicles on their right.
